org.ossnipes.snipes.lib.irc
Class BotUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.ossnipes.snipes.lib.irc.BotUtils
All Implemented Interfaces:
BotConstants
public class BotUtils
extends java.lang.Object
implements BotConstants

Utility methods used a lot in the bot and not really tied to a certain class. This class also contains an important method that is at the core of the Snipes event-sending mechanism. All the methods in this class are static.

Since:
Snipes 0.6

Method Detail

stringObjectArraysToStringObjectMap

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> stringObjectArraysToStringObjectMap(java.lang.String[] keys,
                                                                                                   java.lang.Object[] values)
Takes a String array and a Object array and outputs a Map of Strings (keys) and Objects.
The main use of this method is to convert arrays given as parameters to EventArgs.EventArgs(String[], String[])
to a HashMap (how event arguments are stored internally.)

Parameters:
keys - The first array, used as the keys in the map.
values - The second array, used as values in the map for the keys with the same index.
Returns:
A String Object Map, with the keys array as keys and the values array as values.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If keys.length != values.length.

sendEvent

public static void sendEvent(Event ev,
                             EventArgs args,
                             IRCBase bot)
This method is the heart of the Snipes event-sending mechanism. It sends the event specified by ev with the parameters in args to all registered IRCEventListeners.
This method treats IRCBases specially, casting them down to IRCBase and calling it's IRCBase.handleInternalEvent(Event, EventArgs) method.

Parameters:
ev - The enumerated identifier for the event to be sent.
args - The arguments object to be passed to the functions.
bot - The bot that this event originated from. This is used to get the event handlers registered to it.

convertToInt

public static java.lang.Integer convertToInt(java.lang.String input)
Does the behaviour of Integer.parseInt(String), but without throwing a Exception. It returns null on error. This method is converted from a method in the fourth post in This thread 15

Parameters:
input - The input String Object.
Returns:
The Integer Object of the number if it is parsable, null otherwise.

isInteger

public static boolean isInteger(java.lang.String s)
Determines if a String can be successfully parsed as a Integer.

Parameters:
s - The String to check
Returns:
True if the String can be parsed as a Integer.
